qmodule.name: Module Demo
qmodule.typeRemark: The type field can be: general/payment/shipping
qmodule.author: C97.net
qmodule.description: This is a demo. Not a real module! Learn how to create a module for qEngine by installing this module.

install.query:
# enter your sql queries (such as CREATE TABLE.... etc) # DO NOT FORGET TO USE __PREFIX__ to add table prefix # __PREFIX__ only available in install & uninstall module
# You can also create files & folders (see below). Files & folders are related to /admin/ folder!
# you can overwrite this standard installation (may be you need to do more complex installation) # simply create an install.php in /admin/module/_YOUR_MODULE_/install.php # qE2 will then use your install.php
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `__PREFIX__demo` ( `idx` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, `ddate` date NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00', `dname` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `daddress` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `dsex` char(1) NOT NULL, `dnotes` text NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`idx`) ) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;

include.remark: include some css & js files if necessary. the files are relative to /skins/_module folder, so "module.css" will open "/skins/_module/module.css"

uninstall.query:
# enter your sql queries (such as DROP TABLE.... etc)
# You need to remove files & folders (files first, then folders) # Folder will be made relative to admin/ folder
# you can overwrite this standard uninstallation (may be you need to do more complex uninstallation) # simply create an uninstall.php in /admin/module/_YOUR_MODULE_/uninstall.php # qE2 will then use your uninstall.php
DROP TABLE `__PREFIX__demo`;

config.remark: This part will be inserted in database during install (table: dbprefix_module_config). And will be read during module execution. Removed during uninstall. If you enter any values here, don't forget to add module configuration function. See configure.php. THIS IS OPTIONAL!

adminMenu.remark: adminTitle = Enter module administration title (such as: Add News, Manage News, Add Category, Add Gallery, etc) adminUrl = Enter module administration URL (for example, if your file is edit.php, use: task.php?mod=demo&run=edit.php) NOTICE! task.php?mod=demo&run=edit.php (NOTICE the & WHY? Just do it!) THIS IS OPTIONAL!
